Introduction to Integration

Lesson
objectives ¢ Identify common Integration Mechanisms

used in InsuranceSuite

¢ Describe integration mechanisms commonly
used by technical consultants

¢ List resources available to technical
consultants

i InsuranceSuite integration mechanisms: Overview [Fj

¢ InsuranceSuite implementations use
a wide variety of industry-standard yay cient /
mechanisms to share information Web Browser
with external systems, including:

Java EE
Application Server

* Batch processes*
« Database tables

+ Web Services*

External
Systems

Guidewire

Messaging Database

« Plugins*

* Details provided in a separate lesson

i Integration mechanism: Batch processes Gi

G BK &

=
Exchange Rate System

Exchange Rate

¢« Abatch process is a background process that performs a periodic task
independent of a user

« Example: Exchange Rate batch process queries an external system for exchange rates on a
schedule

¢ May execute logic entirely within InsuranceSuite or interact with other systems

¢ Anexternal system calling an InsuranceSuite API may trigger a batch process to
run

i Integration Mechanism: Integration tables

GF —f—a

—
Guidewire Database External
Application Tables System

An integration table is a database table that both systems can access
* Query for near real-time
* Batch process for delayed and/or scheduled
¢ Data access technologies -JDBC, Spring, Hibernate

i Integration Tables for file-based exchange

=
> > Sal

[= Le externa
System

i

Guidewire

Application Integration File

Table

Integration table for file-based exchange:
¢ For file-based data exchange, write data to the integration table first
* Then, generate the file from the integration table, for example, with a batch process, later

i Integration Mechanism: Web services Gi

¢ Web services are information
exchange systems that use the
Internet for direct application-to-
application interaction

* Typically, exchange of information is
synchronous and blocking

+ The process calling the API halts any
further action until the API has responded
to the request

* Guidewire supports two types:

+ RESTful (Representational State
Transfer)

+ SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol)

* InsuranceSuite applications can

both publish and/or consume web
services

¢ Publish example below:

+ lAccountAPI web service with doesexist
method

lAccountAPI External
Web Service System

Does Account 4713 exist?

=

false

i Integration Mechanism: Messaging Gi

Message Message Queue
GY —_&
————

Response me

Guidewire External
Application System

* One system sends a message to another system, which is placed in a queue, and
at a later point in time, the other system processes the message

* Typically, the target system provides an asynchronous, unequivocal acknowledgement when it
receives or processes the message

* Common messaging technologies:
« JMS
« MQSeries

i Messaging in InsuranceSuite: An example

io

« Asynchronous messaging with an event-based model.

Check data

Mi

yw &

Reply with check number Check Printing
System

* Subscription model to guarantee at-least-once delivery of all messages

i Integration Mechanism: Startable plugins

Startable Plugin

oe a=

System

¢ Astartable plugin is a mechanism that listens for requests from an external
system that communicates with InsuranceSuite via a technology such as:

« JMS Messaging

¢ Triggered by an incoming external request and typically processes the message
asynchronously

« Example: BillingCenter accepting payment information from external systems

i Integration Mechanism: Predefined plugins Gi

¢ Apredefined plugin is a Gosu class which implements a set of methods called by
internal code and related to fundamental application behavior

« For example, the authentication plugin implements methods that define how authentication is
executed

¢ Predefined plugins may or may not interact with other systems

« When predefined plugins interact with other systems, they are typically outbound and
synchronous

i The training environment

¢ This course make the following assumptions:
* You are working in development mode
« EnablelnternalDebugTools parameter in config.xml has been set to true
« You are using the Dynamic Code Evolution Virtual Machine (DCEVM)
¢ All Guidewire applications are located in the C:\GW directory
¢ The training environment also provides the following resources:
* TrainingApp
« ExternalApp

i TrainingApp for integration students Gi

Details A
Lawsuits

Person Info | Phone & Addresses Bank Accounts —_ Analysis

Name Lawsuits Date Plaintiff
FullName Rebecca Stevens
Prefix

FirstName Rebecca

Date Plaintiff

Middle Name

* TrainingApp is a modified version of ContactManager
+ Not sold as a genuine Guidewire product
+ Used exclusively by Guidewire Education
*  TrainingApp has resources for integration students, including:
+ Example integration points
+ Admin screens that display data relevant to integration

+ Admin screens that demo internal integration functionality

i ExternalApp for integration students

+ | Bteraltpp

LW projectverionproperties 1078/16826°
Gi reavmene roni9n2:

« ExternalApp is a modifi ied version of ContactManager that simulates a variety of
external systems

298M Shortcut

* Not sold as a genuine Guidewire product
« Used exclusively by Guidewire Education

¢ You will not configure ExternalApp

* You'll simply start it, stop it, and build integration points to it

i Guidewire integration documentation Gi

¢ Guidewire Integration Guide * Guidewire Configuration Guide

¢ For questions specific to integration * Occasionally needed for some
mechanisms integration steps
* Guidewire Gosu Reference * Also documents functionality of every
| Studio editor (including some that are

¢ For questions specific to Gosu exclusive to integration)

* Guidewire Rules Guide * Generated documentation
+ Useful for integration points that require + Data and security dictionaries

rules, especially messaging
* GosuDocs

« Javadocs

i Deploying integration resources Ga

Resource Name New
RESTART RESTART
RESTART RESTART
RESTART RESTART
ALT + SHIFT +L ALT + SHIFT +L
ALT + SHIFT +L / RELOAD ALT + SHIFT + L/ RELOAD
RESTART RELOAD
RESTART RELOAD

Gosu Enhancement RESTART RELOAD

* Inadevelopment environment, resources require different actions to be deployed
+ ALT + SHIFT + L: reloads PCF and displaykey changes without restarting the Server

+ RELOAD: In Studio, Run> Reload Changed Classes

+ Deploying Gosu changes in a local development environment only works if DCEVM is installed on your
development machine

* Restarting the server always deploys all changed resources

Question

_ _ Information exchange between systems that use the Internet for direct
¢

; application-to-application interactions are known as:

“ A) Messaging

B) Batch Processes
C) Web Services

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Gi

Answer

Information exchange between systems that use the Internet for direct
¢~ ~ application-to-application interactions are known as:

? A) Messaging
B) Batch Processes
C) Web Services

The correct answer is C) Web Services.

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

Gi

Question

For each of the InsuranceSuite integration mechanisms, identify its
typical “timing” (synchronous, asynchronous, or scheduled) and initial
,’ direction (outbound or inbound):

¢
4

Predefined plugins
Web services
Messaging

Startable plugins

moom>

Batch processes

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Answer Gi

_— — For each of the InsuranceSuite integration mechanisms, identify its
Pa typical "timing" (synchronous, asynchronous, or scheduled) and initial
direction (outbound or inbound):

Predefined plugins — Synchronous and outbound
Web services — Synchronous and inbound
Messaging — Asynchronous and outbound

Startable plugins — Asynchronous and inbound

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

moo >

Batch processes — Scheduled and outbound

objectives ¢ Identify common technologies and strategies
review used for integration

¢ Describe mechanisms commonly used by
technical consultants

¢ List resources available to technical
